Description: Shoulder fragment from North Ionian black-figured pottery closed vase, probably oinochoe. Inside reserved; outside, tongues between bands at top of shoulder, animal frieze below - tail of probable lion to right and incised rosettes.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.635)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p. 5 and pl. 3, 22)
